instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b liquid damaged - camera not working
threads.message:
Hello,

This board was liquid damaged, caps: <CAPACITOR>C5025</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7526</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7525</CAPACITOR> was covered in liquid stuff. Also, <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> was covered as well.

Replaced the caps and cleaned up the area and had to replace <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> as it was blown.

Board boots and works fine all expect the camera and for some reason when I try to get into the Apple diagnostics, it goes to the internet recovery then downloads and tries to boot but gets an EFI error Error: 0x8000000000000003, Cannot Load 'EFI/Drivers/TestSupport.efi' If I try with ASD software, an error flashes and then the unit starts booting from the hard disk.

I am not sure if both items are linked or not. anyways, the camera doesn't get detected, I tried connecting the camera from another screen(just the camera connector) it did not detect it either.
Camera connector j3502 
pins:
1 = gnd
2 = 9.8mv
3 = 556mv
4 = 3.4
5 = 3.4
6 = 5v


at a loss on the camera not being seen.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b liquid damaged - camera not working
threads.message:
"3 = 556mv"
There should be 3V, I think; is the normal behaviour for USB D+ line.
Check L3507.
